intro: Paepalanthus brunneus, commonly known as the brown broomstick. This plant is a flowering species native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Paepalanthus brunneus typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions with its succulent-like leaves.
